block.p: Jennifer Kristin Lindbom and Majid Yavary were married yesterday at Westbury Manor in Westbury, N.Y. Ahmad Pakzad, a Muslim minister, performed the ceremony.

The bride, 34, is keeping her name. She is an associate at ACP-Visioning and Planning, an urban planning firm in New York. She was a Peace Corps volunteer in the Philippine province of Leyte from 1997 to 1999. She graduated cum laude from New York University, where she also received a master's in urban planning.
Jennifer Kristin Lindbom and Majid Yavary were married yesterday at Westbury Manor in Westbury, N.Y. Ahmad Pakzad, a Muslim minister, performed the ceremony.
Jennifer Kristin Lindbom and Majid Yavary were married yesterday at Westbury Manor in Westbury, N.Y. Ahmad Pakzad, a Muslim minister, performed the ceremony.

The bride, 34, is keeping her name. She is an associate at ACP-Visioning and Planning, an urban planning firm in New York. She was a Peace Corps volunteer in the Philippine province of Leyte from 1997 to 1999. She graduated cum laude from New York University, where she also received a master's in urban planning.
She is the daughter of Carolyn and Roy Lindbom of Fort Myers, Fla.

The bridegroom, 35, is a senior project manager in New York at Moffatt & Nichol, a Long Beach, Calif., engineering firm, managing marine infrastructure projects. He is also a doctoral candidate in coastal engineering at Stevens Institute of Technology in Hoboken, N.J. He graduated from the University of Ottawa and received a master's in coastal engineering from Queen's University in Kingston, Ontario.
He is the son of Kobra and Eskandar Yavary of La Jolla, Calif.
